title: Utilizing Semiotic Tools in Argumentation Classes: Instructional Design Based on a Critical Discussion Model

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic argumentation structures and content knowledge in science subjects
context.additional_context: A course focused on strengthening preservice science teachers' argumentation lesson design competencies in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can systematically design discussions using semiotic tools (symbols, diagrams, etc.) in science argumentation lessons.
Learners can promote critical thinking by assigning roles (pro/con/judge) in a five-stage argumentation discussion cycle (preparation-claim-counterclaim-evaluation-reflection).
Learners complete project-based assessment by creating argumentation activity outputs in mobile environments and refining them based on peer feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
